column4: U.S. automaker GM names Suryadevara CFO to succeed Stevens
column5: General Motors Co  said on Wednesday Dhivya Suryadevara  currently vice president of corporate finance  will succeed Chuck Stevens on Sept. 1 as chief financial officer of the No. 1 U.S. automaker.

column4: UPDATE 2-U.S. automaker GM names Suryadevara CFO to succeed Stevens
column5: June 13 General Motors Co said on Wednesday Dhivya Suryadevara  currently vice president of corporate finance  will succeed Chuck Stevens on Sept. 1 as chief financial officer of the No. 1 U.S. automaker.

column4: GM CFO Chuck Stevens to retire
column5: June 13 General Motors Co said on Wednesday Chief Financial Officer Chuck Stevens would retire after more than 40 years with the company  effective March 1  2019.

column4: FDA finds deficiencies in Mylan's generic Advair; shares fall
column5: Mylan NV said on Wednesday that U.S. health regulators were unable to approve its generic version of GlaxoSmithKline's blockbuster inhaled lung drug Advair for the second time  as they found "minor deficiencies" in the treatment.

column4: UPDATE 2-FDA finds deficiencies in Mylan's generic Advair; shares fall
column5: * Shares fall 4.5 pct after market (Adds analyst comment; updates shares)

column4: FDA finds deficiencies in Mylan's generic Advair
column5: June 13 U.S. drugmaker Mylan NV said on Wednesday that U.S. health regulators could not approve its generic version of GlaxoSmithKline's blockbuster inhaled lung drug  Advair  and cited "minor deficiencies" with the copycat version.

column4: H&R Block's heavy investments to weigh on future profits  shares sink
column5: Shares of H&R Block Inc  fell as much as 21 percent on Wednesday  after the tax preparer said it expected profit margins to shrink as it invests heavily in technology to lure clients who do their own taxes.

column4: Mexico judge cancels arrest warrant for JPMorgan executive  bank says
column5: MEXICO CITY A judge in Mexico canceled an arrest warrant for the country head of U.S. investment bank JPMorgan Chase & Co  and another employee  the bank said on Wednesday  just days after it was issued.

column4: Brazil watchdog fines Morgan Stanley  RBC for forex manipulation
column5: BRASILIA  June 13 Brazil's antitrust watchdog on Wednesday fined Morgan Stanley and Royal Bank of Canada a total of 42.9 million reais ($11.6 million) for meddling with foreign exchange rates charged to clients.

column4: Envision US$9.9bn leveraged buyout by KKR adds to private equity deal bonanza
column5: NEW YORK (LPC) - Private equity firm KKR & Co’s US$9.9bn leveraged buyout (LBO) of physician service provider Envision Healthcare has helped boost private equity deal volumes to levels not seen since before the credit crisis.

column4: Envision US$9.9bn leveraged buyout by KKR adds to private equity deal bonanza
column5: NEW YORK  June 13 (LPC) - Private equity firm KKR & Co’s US$9.9bn leveraged buyout (LBO) of physician service provider Envision Healthcare has helped boost private equity deal volumes to levels not seen since before the credit crisis.

column4: MOVES- Lazard  Aviva  Hong Kong Exchanges and Clearing
column5: June 13 The following financial services industry appointments were announced on Wednesday. To inform us of other job changes  email moves@thomsonreuters.com.

column4: Magna to partner with May Mobility on low-speed self-driving shuttle
column5: Canadian auto parts supplier Magna International Inc will partner with Michigan startup May Mobility on self-driving shuttles  the companies said on Wednesday.

column4: Magna to partner with May Mobility on low-speed self-driving shuttle
column5: June 13 Canadian auto parts supplier Magna International Inc will partner with Michigan startup May Mobility on self-driving shuttles  the companies said on Wednesday.

column4: PBF Chalmette refinery restarts crude unit on Sunday: sources
column5: HOUSTON PBF Energy Inc restarted a crude distillation unit (CDU) on Sunday at its 190 000-barrel-per-day (bpd) Chalmette  Louisiana  refinery  sources familiar with plant operations said on Tuesday.

column4: Former Petrobras CEO Parente invited to lead Brazil's BRF: source
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO Pedro Parente  the former chief executive of state-controlled oil company Petroleo Brasileiro (Petrobras)  has been invited to take over as CEO of Brazilian food processor BRF SA  a source familiar with the process told Reuters on Wednesday.

column4: UPDATE 1-Former Petrobras CEO Parente invited to lead Brazil's BRF -source
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO  June 13 Pedro Parente  the former chief executive of state-controlled oil company Petroleo Brasileiro (Petrobras)  has been invited to take over as CEO of Brazilian food processor BRF SA  a source familiar with the process told Reuters on Wednesday.

column4: Leftist presidential hopeful would end Brazil oil refining monopoly: adviser
column5: SAO PAULO The leading leftist candidate in Brazil's presidential race  Ciro Gomes  would end the refining monopoly of state oil company Petroleo Brasileiro SA  a senior Gomes adviser told Reuters.

column4: Leftist presidential hopeful would end Brazil oil refining monopoly -adviser
column5: SAO PAULO  June 13 The leading leftist candidate in Brazil's presidential race  Ciro Gomes  would end the refining monopoly of state oil company Petroleo Brasileiro SA   a senior Gomes adviser told Reuters.

column4: Former Petrobras CEO Parente invited to lead Brazil's BRF -source
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO  June 13 Pedro Parente  the former chief executive of state-controlled oil company Petroleo Brasileiro (Petrobras)  has been invited to take over as CEO of Brazilian food processor BRF SA  a source familiar with the process told Reuters on Wednesday.

column4: Pfizer wins appeal in litigation claiming Lipitor causes diabetes
column5: A federal appeals court on Tuesday upheld the dismissal of lawsuits by thousands of women claiming Pfizer Inc's cholesterol-lowering drug Lipitor caused them to develop diabetes.

column4: UPDATE 1-Phillips 66 to expand Texas natural gas liquids project
column5: June 13 U.S. oil refiner Phillips 66 said on Wednesday it planned to spend up to $1.5 billion on the expansion of its natural gas liquids project in Sweeny  Texas.

column4: CORRECTED-Phillips 66 to expand Texas natural gas liquids project
column5: June 13 U.S. oil refiner Phillips 66 said on Wednesday it plans to expand its natural gas liquids project in Sweeny  Texas.

column4: Linde-Praxair deal gets Brazil antitrust nod
column5: BRASILIA Brazil's antitrust regulator on Wednesday approved the $80 billion merger of gas group Linde AG and Praxair Inc  as long as the companies go ahead with an undisclosed asset sale plan.

column4: Linde-Praxair deal gets Brazil antitrust nod
column5: BRASILIA  June 13 Brazil's antitrust regulator on Wednesday approved the $80 billion merger of gas group Linde AG and Praxair Inc  as long as the companies go ahead with an undisclosed asset sale plan.

column5: * RBC to cut 20 percent of branch square footage (Recasts  adds CEO comments on NAFTA negotiations)

column4: Royal Bank of Canada to cut branch space by at least 20 percent
column5: TORONTO  June 13 Royal Bank of Canada said on Wednesday it plans to reduce the total square footage of its branch network by at least 20 percent over the next five years  responding to clients doing more of their banking online.

column4: UK watchdog to complete enforcement probe into RBS business unit in July
column5: LONDON  June 13 Britain's markets watchdog said it expected to complete its enforcement investigation into alleged mistreatment by Royal Bank of Scotland of small business customers by the end of next month.

column4: Study confirms higher risk of dengue in kids who got Sanofi vaccine
column5: CHICAGO An analysis of data on Sanofi's dengue vaccine  which has been given to more than 800 000 school children in the Philippines  confirms it increases the risk of hospitalization and severe dengue in those who had never previously been infected with the mosquito-borne virus.

column4: Study confirms higher risk of dengue in kids who got Sanofi vaccine

column4: UPDATE 3-Payments company Adyen evokes tech bubble as share price doubles on market debut
column5: * Soaring debut prompts debate over whether offer mispriced (Updates with banking industry comment on unusual price rise)

column4: CORRECTED-UPDATE 2-Payments company Adyen evokes tech bubble as share price doubles on market debut
column5: AMSTERDAM  June 13 Shares in Adyen    which handles the payments backend for Netflix   Facebook and eBay  doubled on Wednesday in a market debut reminiscent of the 1999 tech bubble.

column4: M&A gates open with judge's blessing on AT&T-Time Warner merger
column5: A federal judge on Tuesday gave a ringing endorsement to AT&T Inc's planned acquisition of Time Warner Inc without any conditions  opening the door for companies such as Comcast Corp and Verizon Communications Inc to pursue deals to buy creators of media content.

column4: Medical device maker Stryker says not in talks to buy Boston Scientific
column5: Medical device maker Stryker Corp  is not in talks to buy rival Boston Scientific Corp   the company said in a regulatory filing https://bit.ly/2Jy6VQB on Wednesday  two days after a media report of a potential deal between the two surfaced.

column4: UPDATE 2-Medical device maker Stryker says not in talks to buy Boston Scientific

column5: June 13 Medical device maker Stryker Corp was not in discussions to buy rival Boston Scientific Corp  Stryker said in a regulatory filing https://bit.ly/2Jy6VQB on Wednesday.

column4: Blackstone raises $9.4 billion for Asia real estate  private equity funds
column5: HONG KONG Blackstone Group LP  said it has raised about $9.4 billion for two new funds - the largest-ever fund dedicated to real estate investments in Asia as well as its first private equity fund for the region.

column4: UPDATE 2-Blackstone raises $9.4 bln for Asia real estate  private equity funds
column5: * Firm's fundraising comes amid slew of new capital raised in Asia

column4: Blackstone in agreement to acquire Australia's Investa Office Fund for $2.3 billion
column5: Australia's Investa Office Fund (IOF)  and Blackstone Group  on Wednesday entered into a scheme implementation agreement through which the U.S. private equity giant would acquire real estate investment trust for A$3.08 billion ($2.3 billion).

column4: Reuters receives eight Society of Publishers in Asia Awards honors
column5: On Wednesday  Reuters received eight recognitions at the Society of Publishers in Asia (SOPA) Awards ceremony in Hong Kong – four Awards of Excellence and four Honorable Mentions. The SOPA Awards honor excellence in traditional and new media coverage of Asia.

column5: Twenty-First Century Fox Inc's shares hit a record high on Wednesday as approval for AT&T Inc's $85 billion buyout of Time Warner Inc spurred speculation that Comcast Corp would make an offer for most of Fox's assets.

column5: June 13 U.S. stock indexes opened little changed on Wednesday as gains in healthcare stocks offset losses in AT&T  whose $85 billion takeover of Time Warner was approved by a court.

column4: Toyota pumps $1 billion in Grab in auto industry's biggest ride-hailing bet
column5: SINGAPORE Toyota Motor Corp has agreed to buy a $1 billion stake in Southeast Asia's Grab in the biggest investment by a carmaker into a ride-hailing firm  at a time when traditional automakers are racing to team up with disruptive tech companies.

column4: UPDATE 3-Toyota pumps $1 bln in Grab in auto industry's biggest ride-hailing bet
column5: * Will offer data-based services to Grab drivers (Recasts  adds Grab comment)

column4: Toyota Motor to invest $1 bln in Southeast Asia's Grab
column5: SINGAPORE  June 13 Toyota Motor Corp has agreed to invest $1 billion in Southeast Asian ride-hailing firm Grab as a lead investor in the company's ongoing financing round. The investment by Toyota is the largest-ever by an automotive manufacturer in the global ride-hailing sector  Grab said in a statement on Wednesday. (Reporting by Aradhana Aravindan; Editing by Himani Sarkar)

column4: TransCanada working on Leach Xpress natgas pipe after W.Va. blast
column5: June 13 TransCanada Corp's Columbia Gas Transmission (TCO) unit said it was working on a section of the Leach Xpress natural gas pipeline downstream of a pipe blast in West Virginia last week.

column4: Comcast offers $65 billion to lure Fox from Disney bid
column5: Comcast Corp  offered $65 billion on Wednesday to lure Twenty-First Century Fox Inc  away from a merger with Walt Disney Co   setting up a bidding war between two of the largest U.S. media companies with its 20 percent higher offer. | Video

column4: UPDATE 5-Comcast offers $65 bln to lure Fox from Disney bid
column5: June 13 Comcast Corp offered $65 billion on Wednesday to lure Twenty-First Century Fox Inc away from a merger with Walt Disney Co  setting up a bidding war between two of the largest U.S. media companies with its 20 percent higher offer.

column4: Comcast offers to buy Fox media assets for $65 bln in cash
column5: June 13 Comcast Corp on Wednesday offered $65 billion for the businesses Twenty-First Century Fox had already agreed to sell to Walt Disney Co  a day after AT&T won approval to buy Time Warner.

column5: AT&T Inc won approval from a U.S. court on Tuesday to buy Time Warner Inc for $85 billion  allowing AT&T to compete with internet companies that dominate digital advertising and providing new sources of revenue.

column5: June 13 Canadian utility AltaGas Ltd said on Wednesday it would sell a 35 percent stake in three hydroelectric projects in     Northwest British Columbia for C$922 million ($707.87 million) to help fund its acquisition of U.S.-based WGL Holdings Inc.

column5: June 13 Canadian utility AltaGas Ltd said on Wednesday it would sell a 35 percent stake in the Northwest British Columbia Hydro Electric Facilities for C$922 million ($707.87 million).

column4: Sorrell haunts WPP as shareholders rebel over farewell package
column5: LONDON Angry WPP  shareholders rebelled on Wednesday at an annual meeting dominated by differences over the departure of the advertising firm's former chief executive Martin Sorrell.

column4: UPDATE 4-Sorrell haunts WPP as shareholders rebel over farewell package
column5: * Analyst says trading update should reassure (Releads  writes through with details)

column4: WPP says 30 percent of shareholder votes fail to back Sorrell remuneration package
column5: LONDON Nearly 30 percent of WPP  shareholders failed to back its executive pay proposal on Wednesday as shareholders expressed their anger over the handling of founder Martin Sorrell's departure.

column4: Hunt for new WPP CEO after Sorrell is 'well advanced': chairman
column5: LONDON The hunt for a new chief executive of WPP  after the sudden departure of Martin Sorrell in April is well advanced and moving ahead rapidly  Chairman Roberto Quarta told the advertising company's annual general meeting on Wednesday.

column4: WPP chairman defends company's handling of allegation against Sorrell
column5: LONDON  June 13 The chairman of the world's biggest advertising agency WPP  facing investor anger over the departure of former CEO Martin Sorrell  defended the company's handling of the process and said he could not say anything more on the matter.
